html: Today in Winthrop we’re celebrating the protection of more than 340,000 acres in the #MethowValley from the development of a large-scale copper mine. This landmark conservation achievement represents one of the largest mineral withdrawals in Washington state’s history.
text: Today in Winthrop we’re celebrating the protection of more than 340,000 acres in the #MethowValley from the development of a large-scale copper mine. This landmark conservation achievement represents one of the largest mineral withdrawals in Washington state’s history.

html: Nearly 1 million people visit the #MethowValley every year, and recreation in the valley contributes more than $150 million annually to the Okanogan County economy. This place is special and we will protect it from mining. @MethowHeadwater
text: Nearly 1 million people visit the #MethowValley every year, and recreation in the valley contributes more than $150 million annually to the Okanogan County economy. This place is special and we will protect it from mining. @MethowHeadwater

html: On the road to Winthrop today and I had to stop and enjoy the view. What a beautiful state we live in! pic.twitter.com/uqTLLE3PZy
text: On the road to Winthrop today and I had to stop and enjoy the view. What a beautiful state we live in! pic.twitter.com/uqTLLE3PZy

html: Protecting the #MethowValley is important to the jobs, businesses, creatures, and people who depend on these lands. We've permanently withdrawn more than 340,000 acres of @ForestService land in the Methow from mineral development.
text: Protecting the #MethowValley is important to the jobs, businesses, creatures, and people who depend on these lands. We've permanently withdrawn more than 340,000 acres of @ForestService land in the Methow from mineral development.

html: The Methow Valley is truly a special place. A copper mine in the heart of the valley would have threatened everything that makes this place a treasure. We passed the #Methow Headwaters Protection Act to put a stop to mining threats for good.
text: The Methow Valley is truly a special place. A copper mine in the heart of the valley would have threatened everything that makes this place a treasure. We passed the #Methow Headwaters Protection Act to put a stop to mining threats for good.

html: The Upper #Methow is essential to salmon recovery, and more than $100 million has been invested in restoration & conservation efforts in the #MethowValley alone. Last month, the president signed my legislation to protect critical streams, creeks, and wildlife in the valley.
text: The Upper #Methow is essential to salmon recovery, and more than $100 million has been invested in restoration & conservation efforts in the #MethowValley alone. Last month, the president signed my legislation to protect critical streams, creeks, and wildlife in the valley.

html: According to @Oceana, more than 73 million #sharks end up in the global shark fin trade every year. Washington state passed a shark fin ban in 2011 and I strongly support enacting national policies to end the shark fin trade and protect these animals. #FinBanNow

html: The @SenateCommerce Committee passed my National #Landslide Preparedness Act on a bipartisan basis. This legislation will: Expand early warning systems Create a new federal program focused on landslide hazards Develop new maps to help communities prepare for landslide risks
text:
The @SenateCommerce Committee passed my National #Landslide Preparedness Act on a bipartisan basis. This legislation will:
Expand early warning systems
Create a new federal program focused on landslide hazards
Develop new maps to help communities prepare for landslide risks

html: What happens if the Affordable Care Act is struck down? 17-20 million Americans would lose health insurance coverage Coverage for those with pre-existing conditions would no longer be guaranteed Caps on out-of-pocket patient costs would be eliminated #ProtectOurCare
text:
What happens if the Affordable Care Act is struck down?

17-20 million Americans would lose health insurance coverage
Coverage for those with pre-existing conditions would no longer be guaranteed
Caps on out-of-pocket patient costs would be eliminated

#ProtectOurCare

html: Tomorrow we’re introducing legislation to reverse the disastrous #FCC repeal of critical #NetNeutrality protections. Our bill would prevent internet companies from slowing down, throttling, or drastically raising prices on internet access. #SaveTheNet

html: If people don’t have health insurance or can’t pay for it, they don’t just disappear. They end up needing emergency care at a very high cost. We can't go backwards, as President Trump wants, by eliminating protections for pre-existing conditions. We must #ProtectOurCare.
text: If people don’t have health insurance or can’t pay for it, they don’t just disappear. They end up needing emergency care at a very high cost. We can't go backwards, as President Trump wants, by eliminating protections for pre-existing conditions. We must #ProtectOurCare.

html: Denying #healthcare to those with pre-existing conditions would cost everyone more in the end. Emergency rooms would be flooded with people waiting to get care, and those costs would be astronomical. Health care rates for all of us could increase.

html: 1 in every 5 women will experience sexual assault in their lifetime, and the number is even higher in Indian Country. Many Native American women face barriers that can prevent the perpetrators from being convicted. We can no longer sweep these statistics under the rug.

html: Our earthquake preparedness bill was signed into law. Improves earthquake early warning systems Helps states prioritize earthquake preparedness Requires updated, state-of-the-art maps to better understand local geographies Cuts red tape to improve information sharing
text:
Our earthquake preparedness bill was signed into law.
Improves earthquake early warning systems
Helps states prioritize earthquake preparedness
Requires updated, state-of-the-art maps to better understand local geographies
Cuts red tape to improve information sharing
